      <div class="content">
                  
            <h2>&nbsp;</h2>
            <h2>NDSU CS Alumni Hall of Fame</h2>
            The CS faculty consider all our alumni to be members of the CS Hall of Fame. All have survived, and in many cases excelled, in what we consider to be the most stringent computer science program in the region. The gasps of relief when receiving their diplomas attest to these statements. Anyone not understanding our calling this a &quot;Hall of Fame&quot; is probably not an NDSU CS degree holder.<br />
            <br />
            <a href="scholarships.htm">Alumni giving to CS Scholarship Fund</a> <br />
            <a href="alumniform.htm">Alumni feedback opportunity</a><br />
  <br />
          We know there are still numerous errors in this list and hope that by publishing this list we will arouse your interest in correcting the entries you know are wrong, and help you to contact old friends. We do not intend to publish street addresses nor phone numbers here. We do hope to get e-mail addresses, company name, and Web links from as many as possible. You may omit your company name if you like, but when students look for internships or employment they often ask us for contacts at a given company. We will also provide a Web link for any company employing our alumni if we have the link. <br />
  <br />
  <h3>Alumni Hall of Fame List - by year of graduation (first NDSU degree)</h3>
  <ul>
    <li><a href="alumni4179.htm">1941-1979</a> </li>
    <li><a href="alumni8089.htm"> 1980-1989</a></li>
    <li><a href="alumni9099.htm"> 1990-1999</a></li>
    <li><a href="alumni0010.htm"> 2000-2010</a></li>
  </ul>
      </div>
